step1.sentence: The new competitor turned out to be the wild card that nobody had anticipated, disrupting the entire market overnight.

step2.story: The team had planned everything carefully, but the weather turned out to be the wild card that threw off their entire schedule. What started as a clear morning quickly became a thunderstorm, forcing them to improvise on the spot.

step3.story: Everyone at the company had mapped out the product launch down to the last detail, confident that nothing could go wrong. Then the supplier backed out at the last minute — a true wild card that no one had seen coming. The team scrambled for two sleepless nights, sourcing an alternative and reworking the logistics from scratch. In the end, the crisis forced them to discover a better supplier at a lower cost. What had seemed like a disaster became an unexpected advantage, all because of that one wild card moment that shook them out of their comfort zone.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 카드 게임에서 어떤 패로도 사용될 수 있는 '조커' 카드를 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 결과를 예측하기 어렵게 만드는 불확실한 요소나 변수를 가리킬 때 사용하며, 사람·사건·상황 모두에 쓸 수 있습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 카드 게임에서 유래한 표현으로, 어떤 역할도 대신할 수 있는 특별 카드(wild card)에서 비롯되어 '예측 불가한 변수'라는 뜻으로 확장되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 긍정적·부정적 상황 모두에 중립적으로 사용되며, 불확실성을 강조하는 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 스포츠·비즈니스·정치 등 다양한 맥락에서 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: His last-minute entry was the wild card that changed the entire outcome of the competition.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그의 막판 참가가 대회 전체의 결과를 바꾼 예측 불가능한 요소였다.
